revised_title: Investigating the Distribution of Scattered Röntgen Radiation
tldr: The authors investigate the distribution of scattered Röntgen radiation and find that there is more radiation scattered in the forward direction than in the backward direction. This dissymmetry increases as the angle with the primary beam decreases. The excess of forward scattered radiation is not explained by the symmetrical scattering of the primary beam and may be due to other factors such as irregular refractions or deflections of the primary ray.
